title: Juan Pablo Montes
text:
Juan Pablo Montes Montes (born 26 October 1985 in <a href="Sulaco%2C%20Yoro">Sulaco, Yoro</a>, Honduras) is a <a href="List%20of%20Hondurans">Honduran</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who most recently played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> for <a href="F.C.%20Motagua">F.C. Motagua</a> in the <a href="Liga%20Nacional%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Profesional%20de%20Honduras">Honduran Liga Nacional</a>.
Club career.
Montes started his career at <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Olanchano">Atlético Olanchano</a>, then had a three year-spell at <a href="C.D.%20Victoria">Victoria</a>. He joined <a href="C.D.S.%20Vida">Vida</a> in summer 2011 but was out for the season due to a broken foot. Montes moved on to <a href="C.D.%20Necaxa">Necaxa</a> in January 2012 and then <a href="Platense%20F.C.">Platense</a>, changing clubs every season since leaving Victoria.
He joined <a href="F.C.%20Motagua">F.C. Motagua</a> for the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20C.D.%20Motagua%20season">2013–14 season</a>, where he has won several championships. He was nominated in the Best XI at the <a href="2018%20CONCACAF%20Awards">2018 CONCACAF Awards</a>.
International career.
Montes made his debut for <a href="Honduras%20national%20football%20team">Honduras</a> in a January <a href="2013%20Copa%20Centroamericana">2013 Copa Centroamericana</a> match against <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a>. As of February 2015, Montes has earned a total of sixteen caps, scoring twice.
